ul.li: Expert Choice: Backed by 10+ years of installation experience, Thermal ducting is our recommendation.
Hassle Assembly: Thermal ducting doesn’t require additional insulation, solvents, or glues – just basic tools.
Effortless Maintenance: Save time during installation and maintenance; a 75mm and 90mm size wall measuring gauge are all you need.
Connections: Unlike PVC, no sealing tape or insulated wrapping needed. Just click and go.
Insulation Worries: Thermal ducting requires no insulation unlike PVC which needs added insulation.
Adaptability: If you prefer a PVC system, we can accommodate and install.

div.p: A. Machine – Also known as the unit - this is the central part of your system we stock and supply Brink, Avia and Vent-Axia.

B. External Supply and Extract – The external venting points can go through a wall or a roof depending on the project’s limitations - always look to keep a distance of 1.5m between these or use a specialised wall cowl designed for close proximity venting.

C. Thermal piping from the machine to the Manifolds – Between your machine and manifolds we advise to use thermally insulated ducting - in this run if your machine does not come with silencers built in we will always include silencers in the kit - in this run is where the silencers will be placed.

D. Manifolds or Distribution boxes – You will need 2 of these depending on your project 1 will be solely for extracting the stale, humid and warm air from your Kitchens, Bathrooms etc and one will be for supplying the fresh air back into the building.
E. Semi Rigid Radial pipe – We typically use a 75mm semi rigid Anti-Bacterial and Anti-static pipe - Normally there will be 2 of these pipes running to each plenum.

F. Plenum and Valves – The 2 radial pipes will run into the plenum which will then go down at a 90 degree angle into a 125mm opening this is where you will then place your valve into after trimming flush - The valve will be the only thing you see once the fitting is completed.

td.p: Airtightness has become a key factor when constructing modern homes to meet today’s performance standards. Achieving proper airtightness significantly enhances energy efficiency, reduces drafts, and ensures consistent comfort levels throughout your home. These benefits can be achieved effectively using HEAT RECOVERY DIRECT products.

div.p: Reducing Heat Loss – If you have insulated the house well it doesn’t always mean that the house is preforming well with regards to heat loss. If you have not used airtightness tapes and membrane, then you can still lose significant heat energy due to “Uncontrolled Ventilation”. Good airtightness will also help keep your energy bills down.
Build Protection – Good airtightness helps protect all building fabrics from moisture in the air preventing interstitial condensation.

Living in Comfort – Good Airtightness will prevent internal drafts. A small amount of air travelling through the smallest gap can be felt as a cold draft especially in colder climates. Improving airtightness of a building will therefore be likely to improve comfort.

div.h3: Benefits of Installing a Heat Pump
div.p: Energy Efficiency: Heat pumps provide highly efficient heating and cooling by transferring heat rather than generating it, significantly reducing energy consumption and utility bills.
Lower Carbon Footprint: Using renewable energy from the air or ground, heat pumps help reduce greenhouse gas emissions compared to traditional fossil fuel systems.
Year-Round Comfort: Heat pumps deliver consistent heating in winter and cooling in summer, improving indoor comfort all year.
Long-Term Savings: Although the initial investment may be higher, heat pumps often lower overall operating costs due to their efficiency and potential eligibility for government incentives.
Low Maintenance: Heat pumps have fewer mechanical parts than combustion systems, which can lead to lower maintenance requirements and longer equipment life.
Quiet Operation: Modern heat pumps operate quietly, ensuring minimal noise disturbance.
Increased Property Value: Installing a heat pump can enhance your property’s value by making it more energy-efficient and attractive to environmentally conscious buyers.
